item.title: Stata Export Word Tables
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: GPT Summary: This article introduces commonly used table output commands in economic empirical papers, including estout, asdoc, logout, outreg2, putdocx series, and etable. Each command has its features and applicable scenarios, such as estout for versatile custom effects and LaTeX output, asdoc for descriptive statistics, logout for diverse statistical result outputs, outreg2 for aesthetically pleasing regression result outputs, the putdocx series for exporting multiple tables into a single Word file, and etable, which supports Chinese encoding in Stata 17. Example codes demonstrate the basic usage and output effects of each command, helping readers select suitable commands for table outputs.

item.title: HLT: Lifecycle and Wage Decomposition
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: GPT: The text discusses the decomposition of wages throughout individuals lifecycles using the APC (Age-Period-Cohort) panel model and the Heckman-Lochner-Taber (HLT) approach. The Mincer earnings function forms the basis for this analysis, focusing on the relationships between education level, work experience, and wages. However, traditional decompositions face challenges due to collinearity between age, birth year, and current year. Deatons method addresses this by isolating time and cohort effects, allowing for separate analysis. The HLT approach further dissects wage growth, suggesting that as individuals near retirement, wage growth is primarily influenced by the time effect rather than human capital investment. This comprehensive approach aims to better understand wage dynamics over the course of individuals lives, incorporating factors such as education, work experience, age, and cohort effects.

item.title: Grouping and Measurement of Econometric Data (STATA Version)
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: Notes on econometrics, understanding causality, distinguishing between pooled, fixed, and random effects, and STATA operations. Also, personal understanding of mechanism testing, involving discussions on interaction terms.

item.title: Economic weighting and scoring methods: PCA, CRITIC, EWM
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: Economic weighting and scoring methods: PCA, CRITIC, EWM, COV. Also, some common pitfalls are recorded.

item.title: Convergence: From "The Limit of Equations" to "The Limit of Growth"
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: GPT Summary: This article explores the application and meaning of convergence in the fields of mathematics, probability theory, and economics. Starting from the concepts of limits and convergence in mathematics, it gradually expands to the Law of Large Numbers and the Central Limit Theorem in probability theory, and finally delves into the convergence effect in economics and the convergence tests and club convergence analysis in econometrics.
